intro: Pentopetia ovalifolia subsp. ovalifolia, commonly known as the oval-leaved pentopetia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
